activity.text: My father never ever attended any school. He was a farmer by profession. In his 60s When he was not able to continue with farming.  He started working as shop keeper, a small cabin on the main street of the village, and on/off worked as a daily wager with local farmers. After 10 years  When I (his only son) was 14, I started to insist in front of him to not work and let me take responsibility of the home.  I was not able to see him working in such hard conditions with a full white beard. He then told me "Look son, I am working in my 70s so that you do not have an excuse to quit education." These words of him still echos in my ear and I am not able to rest a full night. Whenever I waste an hour it reminds me of his efforts and works for my success. He worked when others were planning retirement. He worked in June & July, under the skin burning sun, cold nights, and rains. He wanted to see his son, the first family member, to be graduated. It was 3 years before in 2018 when I graduated from FAST NUCES. He was so happy to see me wearing a cap and gown. And I was happy to see him smiling. It was the first time in a decade when we were so much happy as the whole world had been conquered. They say there is women behind every successful man, it may be true in their case but I am heard rephrasing it  "There is a man behind my success.". And I am missing him badly today.PS:My mother was a strong mother. She also struggled a lot, a long side my father in this journey. They both paired up in a battle where they wanted to succeed their only son, to lead future generation. They both belonged to the same socioeconomic class. They both struggled and came out as winner from this battle of gold and silver. Her struggles are also bitter and painful. I may write about her struggles in another post some other day. Bear with me till then ...My Facebook profile: https://lnkd.in/gZmD8vDQ#MissYouMom #MissYouKaka #MissYouFather #lifestories #devcommunity #fatherhood #Father #Inspiring #Motivational

activity.text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai(He gave a speech in only 60 seconds) He said:Imagine life is a game of 5 balls that you manipulate in the air trying not to fall these balls. One of them is rubber, and the rest is glass.The five balls are:Work, family, health, friends, soul.It will not be long before you realize that (work) is a rubber ball. Whenever you fall, you will jump again, while the other balls are made of glass. If one of them falls, it will not return to its previous form.It will either be damaged, bruised, cracked or even scattered.You have to be aware of that and strive for it.Manage your work efficiently during working hours, take the time to be assured of your sincerity, give the necessary time to your family and friends, take appropriate rest, and take care of your health. If you are gone, it isn't easy to return as it was.

activity.act_desc: Chief Data Scientist | AI Strategist | Teaching Gap Skills To Data Scientists | Monetizing Machine Learning
activity.text: Some companies are offering $50-$65/hr. for experienced Data Scientists. With over 100K Data Scientist job openings on LinkedIn alone, lowballing like that is a sign of disrespect.Many Data Scientists are underpaid. If you have 3+ years of experience in the field and are making less than $175K/yr., start sending out your resume.Don’t trust the $130K average Data Scientist salary surveys. Don’t believe it when you hear, “Based on your previous salary, all we can offer you is…” The cost of living in your city has nothing to do with your contribution to the business or compensation for your capabilities.There are excuses like, “You’re not very technical” or “You have experience, just not the right kind of experience” or “You only have a Masters.” If you have been doing the job well for over 3 years, you’ve proven none of that matters.Quality companies and Data Science leaders don’t play any of those games. One of the first things a leader learns is how to get our people paid. If we don’t, we end up surrounded by low performers who can’t get a better job and we don’t last long in a leadership role.Find a company and leadership who values your contributions enough to compensate you. Don’t let anyone talk you into questioning your worth.#datascience #machinelearning

activity.text: darts a Python library for easy manipulation and forecasting of time series. It contains a variety of models, from classics such as ARIMA to deep neural networks. GitHub https://lnkd.in/gmcczzJxThe models can all be used in the same way, using fit() and predict() functions, similar to scikit-learn. The library also makes it easy to backtest models, and combine the predictions of several models and external regressors. Darts supports both univariate and multivariate time series and models. The neural networks can be trained on multiple time series, and some of the models offer probabilistic forecasts._#machinelearning #python #ai #datascience

activity.text: Learning is a process guaranteeing growth so it must be opted throughout ones life. Motivated to learn more and understand the basics on layer and neuron level, I took the first deep learning specialization course made by Andrew Ng and successfully completed it. Despite being a practicing data scientist with versatile experience of more than two years, I found this course very informative and helpful in clearing all the concepts related to deep learning networks. Keep learning and keep growing.

activity.text: My goodness!  Don't you remember when you first went to school?  And you went to kindergarten and in kindergarten, the idea was to push along so that you could get into first grade and then push along so that you could get into second grade, third grade, and so on … Going up and up and then, you went to high school and this was a great transition in life. And now the pressure is being put on, you must get ahead, you must go up the grades and finally be good enough to get to college. And then when you get to college you are still going step by step, step by step, up to the great moment in which you are ready to go out into the world.  And then when you get out into this famous world, comes the struggle for success in profession or business.  And again, there seems to be a ladder before you. Something for which you are reaching all the time. And then suddenly when you are about 40 or 45 years old in the middle of life you wake up one day and say, Huh … I've arrived. And by Joe, I feel pretty much the same as I have always felt. In fact, I’m not so sure that I don't feel a little bit cheated! Because you see you were fooled. You were always living for somewhere, where you aren't.- Alan WattsIn the pursuit of success, do not ignore your present.

activity.text: I would like to announce that I signed an offer letter to join Tesla! Unfortunately...They had decided that due to org changes, I was no longer allowed to start on our agreed upon start date, and they pushed back the start date by two weeks. “Sure, no problem” I said. Then, a few days before the *second* start date, they decided that the position was no longer needed and I am out of a job (before I even started). I did not fail my background check. Nor did I ever act in any manner that would cause a company to rescind their offer like this. Yet, here I am back on my job search because I have already left my previous company. I gave my notice over 6 weeks ago now when I first signed the offer letter.If anyone knows of a need for a full stack software engineer, please feel free to reach out. activity.act_desc: Data Science and AI
activity.text: How to start in Data Science with Python in 8 steps:1. Pick a topic that you want to learn (NLP, Recommendation Systems, etc).2. Select an algorithm that you want to understand.3. Read the paper and take notes.4. Select a library that implements the algorithm in Python (Huggingface Transformers, Microsoft Recommenders, etc).5. Create a Jupyter notebook and install the library dependencies.6. In the first part of the notebook, do a summary of the algorithm.7. In the second part of the notebook, implement a simple example of the algorithm.8. Add the notebook to GitHub and share it on Linkedin.You have just started your career in Data Science and maybe helped others start as well.Vamos!____#ai #artificialintelligence #innovation #technology #machinelearning #deeplearning #personaldevelopment #motivation #mindfulness #whatinspiresme #creativity #future #productivity #inspiration #selfhelp

activity.act_desc: Lead Generation Expert|| OutReach Expert || Business Developer Officer at Codefier
activity.text: How To Easily Win Your First #Job On Upwork 1) You have Limited connects to play.Don't waste them. Just use them carefully and sensibly. Bid on jobs that require 2-4 connects. 2) Bid only between 3am-7am. Mostly freelancers from go to sleep and you have now 90% less competition. You will see only 10-20 proposals on average at this time. Again 80% will be using the copy-paste templates. Now your competition is with only 2-5 people.3) Choose No Hire filter from Client history! Don't pay too much attention to the unverified payment method! As I understand it, verifying their payment method is a matter of the client entering their credit card.4) Choose a job with a long description. The job with detailed explantation.SOME KEY POINTS:• Focus on an issue and write feasible solutions for it. Ask question if necessary.• If required share your proven track record related to it with slight introductory lines.• Always try to write a creative or attractive first line.• Short Introduction about your journey.• Exceptional English is compulsory. Ask him to come online and do a voice session right away. Make a habit of doing voice/video.P:S:After 5-15 proposals you will land your first job. Same amont of effort is required for 3-4 hours/day. #digitalmarketing #marketing #freelancers #upworksuccess #upwork #bidder #outreach #leadgenerationexpert #freelancing

activity.act_desc: Marketing Administrator at Giant Group
activity.text: A 12-year-old boy from London has made about £290,000 during the school holidays, after creating a series of pixelated artworks called Weird Whales and selling non-fungible tokens (NFTs).With NFTs, artwork can be "tokenised" to create a digital certificate of ownership that can be bought and sold. They do not generally give the buyer the actual artwork or its copyright.Benyamin Ahmed is keeping his earnings in the form of Ethereum - the crypto-currency in which they were sold. This means they could go up or down in value and there is no back-up from the authorities if the digital wallet in which he is holding them is hacked or compromised.Ahmed had made a Minecraft-inspired digital-art collection that consisted of 40 colourful, pixelized avatars called Minecraft Yee Haa, however, it did not sell for a whopping amount. And later he went on for Weird Whales.For creating 3,350 emoji-type whales, Benyamin Ahmed used his own program by using a well-known pixelated whale meme image and a popular digital-art style. #digital #art #artwork #marketing #digitalmarketing #publishing #branding #currency #design #startuppakistan

activity.act_desc: VFX Artist at Santa Monica Studio
activity.text: I'M WORKING ON GOD OF WAR: RAGNARÖK!!!!!!!!It has been a wonderful several months with the Santa Monica Studio FX team. I used to watch my brother play God of War as a kid (sorry mom!). I still can't believe I get to be part of this, and that I get to do it for a living.To anyone who is struggling with their passion: I failed several times before finding myself in this spot. I had to take SEVERAL of my game dev classes THREE TIMES because I was too depressed to go, too anxious to return after missing one class, or my ADHD felt like a prison. I went to school for nearly a decade part-time, and I didn't even finish (I think my official GPA is 2.8). Some semesters, I dropped all my classes so I could afford to feed myself. I was laid off from my first dev job four months after being hired full-time, after an entire year on end to end contracts with uncertain ends. I kept trying, anyway!!!!!!!Today, I'm working on a beautiful, historic project with mind-blowingly talented people, my impostor syndrome is NONEXISTENT, and I actually look forward to Mondays.Follow your dreams, work hard, keep going. Anything is possible(...especially if you prioritize your mental health ❤).#Godofwar #ragnarok #gamedev #dreamjob #vfxartist

activity.text: جب جیل پہنچے تو انہوں نے میرا مذاق اڑانا شروع کیا ، میرا مذاق اڑانے لگے کہ میں قدموں سے چل کر جیل کی طرف جاؤں ۔ بھلا میں معذوری میں کیسے چلتا؟؟؟پس انہوں نے مجھے گھسیٹنا شروع کیا اور مجھے گھسیٹ کر ایک تاریک کوٹھڑی میں پھینک دیامیری علالت کسی سے پوشیدہ نہیں ، سب جانتے ہیں کہ مجھ سے فرش پر نہیں بیٹھا جاتا مجھے کوئی پانچ منٹ فرش پہ بٹھا دے مجھ سے نہیں بیٹھا جاتا،،میں نے چھ ماہ ذندان میں فرش پر بیٹھے بیٹھے گزار دیئے ، اف تک نہ کہا """گل وچو ہور اے""بعض دن تو ایسے تھے کہ میں سارا دن بھوکا پیاسا رہتا تھا ، شدید کمزوری میں بھی دل ایک ہی بات کہتا تھا:"کیا ہی فرق پڑتا ہے اگر تجھے یہاں موت آگئ؟؟؟؟ کیا تیرے لئے یہ کافی نہیں کہ رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم کی عزت پر فنا ہو جائے؟"جیل کی حالت عجیب تھی ، دیوار سے پانی بہتا رہتا تھا دسمبر جنوری کی سرد راتوں میں شدید تکلیف ہوتی تھی میرےایک ساتھی سے برداشت نہ ہوا تو اس نے عملے کو کہا:"ہمیں کوئ ہیٹر رکھ دو کہ تم بھی دیکھتے ہو کہ یہاں ایسے لوگ بھی ہیں جو قاتل ہیں، ملک کا خزانہ لوٹنے والا بھی یہاں بیٹھا ہے ، انہیں تو ہیٹر ملیں اور ہم پر ظلم کے پہاڑ توڑے جائیں؟؟؟اسے یہ جواب دے کر خاموش کیا گیا:"انہیں ہیٹر دینے کا آرڈر ہے تم لوگوں کو ہیٹر دینے کا آرڈر نہیں"......میں مسکرا دیا ، بھلا میں نے کوئ قتل کیا تھا؟؟؟؟؟؟؟چوری کی تھی؟؟؟؟؟میرا جرم تو فقط اتنا تھا کہ میں  نے رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم کی ناموس کی بات کیمیرا عمامہ میرا فخر ہے اور علمائے اسلام کی عظمت کی نشانی ہے ، ایک روز انہوں نے مجھے لاٹھیوں سے مارنا شروع کیا تو عمامہ دور جا گرا ، میرا ذھن خندق کے مقتل کی جانب لوٹ گیا جب رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم اپنے مبارک ہاتھوں سے مٹی اٹھاتے تھے حتی کہ حضور علیہ السلام کی سفیدی پوشیدہ ہو گئ بس میرے دل کو قرار آگیا کہ کونسا قیامت آگئ کہ تیرا عمامہ گر گیا؟؟؟؟سرد راتوں میں اکثر تو ایسا ہوتا تھا کہ وہ تمسخر کیلئے مجھ پر ٹھنڈا پانی گرا دیتے تھے،،،،اے امت مسلمہ! activity.act_desc: Chief Solution Architect at Blutech Consulting
activity.text: From my last post related to data engineering related vacancies at Blutech Consulting, I received over 120 resumes both fresh and experienced. Among the fresh graduates 80 percent had Data scientist as title.It might come a bit harsh but I want to point this out that just because you have taken a Python subject in university, it does not make you a data scientist.My advice to all the fresh graduates is that if you have interest in data, start with data engineering, which is as important for data analytics as data science itself. You can always switch to data science once you are comfortable with data. I am saying this because 90% of the people fail to clear the interviews.  #datascience #dataengineering #freshgraduates #consulting #dataanalytics #bigdata #python

activity.text: Ambassador of Pakistan to Italy Jauhar Saleem signaled the start of talks on a ‘labour and labour force import agreement’ between Italy and Pakistan for providing more opportunities to local skilled youth to get employment in the competitive Italian Job market.“The agreement is the need of the hour for the exchange of legal workforce and legal migration between the two countries” he said. The current strong economic and trade ties between the two countries will help foster such agreements, which will bring the two countries closer together, the ambassador said while talking to the media through the 3rd phase of a series of digital ‘Zoom Link’ media talks organised by the embassy of Pakistan in Rome.The ambassador said the Pakistani embassy in Rome is currently working to provide legal assistance to Pakistani migrants, and the ‘Workforce Export Agreement’ between Italy and Pakistan is one such link for creating opportunities for local skilled labour in the Italian market.Jauhar Saleem said Italy and Pakistan have agreed in principle to negotiate a labour agreement that will give Pakistan comprehensive market access to the Italian labour market.#job #opportunities #pakistani #pakistan #final #pact #startuppakistan

activity.text: Pakistan’ technology exports have increased by 80.6 percent in August 2021 over the same month last year, the Ministry of Commerce said.During the month under review, technology exports recorded at $224 million against $124 million in August 2020. Similarly, the exports of information and communication technology increased 46 percent to $420 million in the two months of the current fiscal year, according to central bank figures. Last fiscal, the exports were $287 million.During fiscal year 2020/21, Pakistan’s IT exports increased 47.4 percent, and crossed $2 billion mark for the first time in the country’s history, whereas, in fiscal year 2019/20, the exports were $1.44 billion.The government has focused on technology and IT sector to boost the exports. For this purpose, different incentives are being offered to freelancers. The startups in Pakistan have also made remarkable progress during recent months.According to the International Labour Organization Flagship Report 2021, Pakistan has been ranked as the 2nd largest supplier of online labour in software development and technology. #technology #startups #communication #pakistan #freelancers #bank

activity.text: Famous Canadian Vlogger Rosie Gabrielle announces on Social Media that she is now Permanently moved to Gilgit- Baltistan, North of Pakistan. Further, she expressed that Pakistan is a safe Country & she urges International Vloggers to explore the beauty of Nature in North Pakistan. She added " The long anticipated wait is over! We are happy to share and announce that we have officially shifted to the north of Pakistan. Neither of us are city people or “fit in” with societal “norms” and the system. We long for wide open spaces, fresh air, peace, simple life, nature and ADVENTURE! "With travel restrictions still in force around the globe making getting around too complicated, we decided to stay put for a while here in Pk. But that meant moving somewhere we both could thrive a bit better. Looking to take the stressful pressures off ourselves, focusing more on being present, being in nature, having adventure at our finger tips and generally living a more simple life, this is the PERFECT place to be.We have SO MANY things to share with you about living life in a small village tucked in the mountains. It truly is a DREAM come true MASHALLAH we are so blessed" #socialmedia #travel #people #share #beauty #pakistan #startuppakistan

activity.text: Vast opportunities are present to enhance mutual trade and investment between Pakistan and Italy and businessmen and traders from both countries can reap the benefits, said Ambassador of Italy to Pakistan Andreas Ferrarese.Pakistani workers’ remittances from Italy increased by a staggering 92 percent in August 2021 against those in August 2020, making Italy the largest contributor in remittances from the European Union. Keeping in view the growth trend of the last 12 months, Italy could join the so-called ‘Billion Dollar Club/markets for remittances’ for Pakistan, which could help it address its current account gap.Speaking to the business community in Islamabad, the envoy urged Pakistani businessmen and traders to make efforts to promote mutual trade and economic ties between the two nations.“Economic, trade and cultural relations between Italy and Pakistan are at an all-time high,” he said. “Italy hosts the largest number of Pakistani diaspora in the European Union (EU).”Stating figures, he said that workers remittances from Italy hit historic high of $601 million in FY21 and as a result, Italy emerged as the seventh largest global destination for workers remittances to Pakistan and ranked first among the countries in the EU. #business #growth #opportunities #pakistan #dollar #markets #startuppakistan

activity.act_desc: Chief Solution Architect at Blutech Consulting
activity.text: From my last post related to data engineering related vacancies at Blutech Consulting, I received over 120 resumes both fresh and experienced. Among the fresh graduates 80 percent had Data scientist as title.It might come a bit harsh but I want to point this out that just because you have taken a Python subject in university, it does not make you a data scientist.My advice to all the fresh graduates is that if you have interest in data, start with data engineering, which is as important for data analytics as data science itself. You can always switch to data science once you are comfortable with data. I am saying this because 90% of the people fail to clear the interviews.  #datascience #dataengineering #freshgraduates #consulting #dataanalytics #bigdata #python

activity.text: darts a Python library for easy manipulation and forecasting of time series. It contains a variety of models, from classics such as ARIMA to deep neural networks. GitHub https://lnkd.in/gmcczzJxThe models can all be used in the same way, using fit() and predict() functions, similar to scikit-learn. The library also makes it easy to backtest models, and combine the predictions of several models and external regressors. Darts supports both univariate and multivariate time series and models. The neural networks can be trained on multiple time series, and some of the models offer probabilistic forecasts._#machinelearning #python #ai #datascience

activity.act_desc: CEO Jibble | Meet the new standard in employee time tracking
activity.text: In 1999, Excite was no.2 in search after Yahoo, and Google had just got going.Larry Page offered to sell Google to them for, now wait for it, US$750k and 1% of Excite. Page insisted that Google would have to be the search engine running Excite, and that was where the deal broke down.Excite walked away.Today Google, now called Alphabet, is worth $1.9T.So, Page wanted to sell Google for $750k!? I mean, he clearly didn’t have a clue about Google's potential.He's worth $125bn today. Had he gone ahead with the deal, I doubt he’d be worth more than $50m, and you wouldn’t have heard of Page, Brin, or Google.Most consider a co-founder of Google that was willing to sell it all for $750k as a tech genius, a man with extraordinary vision.He wasn't.Successful CEOs are not superhuman. Many of us are capable of getting there.With hard work and a lot of luck.

activity.text: Good #Code doesn't need comments, It Documents Itself! Every programmer can write #code for machines to understand, a #good programmer writes #code that humans can understand. A good piece of code should speaks for itself, no need for comments. No explication needed😊 Do you always comment on all details in your program?Writing comments, docstrings and choosing appropriate names reasonably for functions, classes, methods and variables makes life much easier for anyone reading through the code in the future. 💻You don’t want your colleagues to be overwhelmed trying to interpret your intentions trough comments.Add comments in places where even reasonable naming, logic, and implementations doesn’t make your intent obvious, straightforward or in places that are too difficult to understand.#programming #coding #datascience #machinelearning #deeplearning #artificialintelligence #ai #analytics #nlp #computervision #tensorflow #pytorch #ml

activity.text: Hi Everyone!I hope you people are living in the best of your health.Just wanted to aware and alert the people who are using Neteller(NETELLER TEAM, NETELLER Support). I found it to be one of the most vulnerable to fraud and least secure fintech platforms present online. Recently, I exchange crypto(USDTs) which were 1300 with USD. I used Neteller as the payment method in Binance. I received the confirmation email from Neteller(NETELLER TEAM, NETELLER Support) in which it was mentioned that my account was undergoing KYC verification and nobody knew other than I and Neteller(NETELLER TEAM, NETELLER Support) and I released the crypto believing in the credibility of the email. When I didn't receive any payment in my Neteller account, I contacted NETELLER Support who said that there was no record of the transaction and that the email was not from Neteller(NETELLER TEAM, NETELLER Support).I was shocked  that how could this happen when no one knew that my account was undergoing KYC verification. I suspect Neteller staff to be involved in this.I tried reaching NETELLER Support multiple times and they said it would take several days to review the case and I expect no help.So,be aware and avoid using this platform.Thanks#fintech #fraudprevention #fraudsters #scandal #fraud #security

When I didn't receive any payment in my Neteller account, I contacted NETELLER Support who said that there was no record of the transaction and that the email was not from Neteller(NETELLER TEAM, NETELLER Support).I was shocked  that how could this happen when no one knew that my account was undergoing KYC verification. I suspect Neteller staff to be involved in this.I tried reaching NETELLER Support multiple times and they said it would take several days to review the case and I expect no help.So,be aware and avoid using this platform.Thanks#fintech #fraudprevention #fraudsters #scandal #fraud #security

activity.act_desc: CEO Jibble | Meet the new standard in employee time tracking
activity.text: A million people start tossing their coin, every time it's tails they're out.After 20 tosses, only one remains - the one that got 20 heads in a row.Now, everyone wants to know how she did it? What tossing technique she used? They admire her focus and attitude before each toss, her immense belief in herself.And this, to a large extent, is how successful entrepreneurs are analysed.Take Jobs. After founding Apple he founded NeXT, a failure. Over 12 years he blew US$100's of millions, wasted $100k on the logo, and according to Jobs himself it never even found a product-market fit.Sure, it was bought by Apple but only because Jobs came with it.One of the world's great entrepreneurs couldn't get a business with tons of funding off the ground for over a decade. Yet kids, fresh from university with no business experience, do on shoestring budgets.Business is far more luck than most of us entrepreneurs want to admit. And it explains why many successful entrepreneurs get Imposter's Syndrome - a fear of being 'found out'. That fear isn't misplaced.Hard work is absolutely crucial for success - but most fail despite it.We all seek the method. But in entrepreneurship, the truth is there is far more madness than there is method.

activity.text: #ZeroShot Learning is the ability to detect classes that the model has never seen during training. It resembles our ability as humans to generalize and identify new things without explicit supervision.For example, let’s say we want to do sentiment classification and news category classification. Normally, we will train/fine-tune a new model for each dataset. In contrast, with zero-shot learning, you can perform tasks such as sentiment and news classification directly without any task-specific training.Whereas, #TransferLearning (TL) is a machine learning (ML) technique that focuses on storing knowledge gained while solving one problem and applying it to a different but related problem with a little task specific training at the end nodes. For example, knowledge gained while learning to recognize cars could apply when trying to recognize trucks.Blogpost: https://lnkd.in/gnkqDkJCredits: Amit, Philip Vollet#machinelearning #nlp #datascience #deeplearning #neuralnetworks #transformers #tensorflow #python #scikitlearn #datascientists #dataengineering #spark #hadoop #datanalytics #datasciencejobs #advancedanalytics #ml #artificialintelligence

If you are gone, it isn't easy to return as it was.

activity.text: COMSATS University Islamabad students are working on a proposal to turn mosquitos into vaccine-carrying syringes. While this occurrence appears to be new, it actually dates back to 2011, when a group of Japanese researchers came up with the notion of turning mosquitoes, the disease’s super-spreaders, into flying vaccines.When mosquitoes bite, they inject a little drop of saliva into our bloodstream, which prevents it from clotting. That set of scientists injected an antigen — a substance that causes the immune system to respond – into the mix of proteins in their saliva.To generate antibodies, mice have to be bitten at least 1500 times every day on average. Despite this, the researchers were unable to ascertain if the antibodies would be sufficient to prevent infection in a human body.Professor Dr. Muhammad Tabassum Afzal, the Rector of COMSATS University, announced this during a session of the Senate Standing Committee on Science and Technology on Wednesday.The Rector informed the committee that varsity students are conducting research on mosquitoes in order to transform them into vaccine speeders rather than disease carriers. #research #students #university #scienceandtechnology #tech #startuppakistan

Chief Data Scientist | AI Strategist | Teaching Gap Skills To Data Scientists | Monetizing Machine Learning
activity.text: Why can’t companies find qualified Data Scientists? Their hiring process is built to eliminate them.It’s not a secret. The major problems are obvious:1. Most senior Data Scientists wouldn’t pass a junior Data Scientists job interview because it has nothing to do with the actual job.2. Qualified candidates are bounced before they make it to the hiring manager because they don’t keyword stuff their resume just the right way.3. Job descriptions contain all the requirements for a Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and Machine Learning Engineer and they expect 1 person to cover 3 roles.4. 3+ rounds of interviews…spend enough time looking for flaws and you’ll find them.5. Every new hire requires training and onboarding so looking for the best or perfect candidate is unrealistic.I’m not sure how they expect to hire people when their entire process is built to exclude people. It’s not difficult to fix either. I’ve rebuilt hiring processes in under a month. I’ve hired entire Data Science teams in 6-12 weeks.I am definitely not the smartest person on Earth or the only one who has figured this out. Companies complaining about talent shortages are like a thirsty kid holding an unopened water bottle surrounded by people telling them how to open it.#datascience #machinelearning
